intro: Micraeschynanthus dischidioides, commonly known as the dwarf shield flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It has palmate leaves and often grows in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
